title: Active Learning Design Workshop for Transitioning to Online Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics knowledge and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Customized workshop for pre-service and in-service elementary teachers to strengthen online transition competencies in mathematics education, involving project-based assessments in BYOD environments and collaboration with instructional design experts

learning_goals: Participants can redesign existing math instructional materials into active online learning modules using a three-stage transformation methodology
Participants develop at least two assessment tools (quizzes, discussion boards, collaborative projects) to promote learner engagement in online environments
Participants improve their course design proposals at least once by incorporating peer feedback

resources: Online collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)
Digital content templates for math education

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
